Reviews.Title: “Great location on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: Robin747474
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in spring break and there was a huge influx of students coming and going from the hotel. The walls seem to be very thin and you can hear everything in the next room and beyond. Bring your earfoams! Beds are hard and lumpy( common in Spain). We did love the location though. The hotel is situated across the street from a metro station and a mall, there are coffee, pastry shops and returants all around. We were warned many times about pick pockets in Madrid although fortunately for everyone in our group we did not experience anything of the sort. Breakfast buffet is typical food that they serve in Spain but plentiful and filling, not enough fruit and healthy options though. Overall I would look for a hotel in this area but not this one, too noisy and uncomfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: SospanAldershot
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a very convenient location, we have stayed there several times as a family, and keep going back as it has everything we need. The rooms are comfortable, the staff are friendly, the breakfast was fine(not the best but definitely not the worst we have had in Europe.) We look forward to going back when next we are in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Nic-NR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel during our short trip to Madrid. It is well located, just opposite the Principle Pio station, which was convenient as it was raining when we arrived. The staff were friendly and polite. The room, though dated (particularly the toilet facilities), was still clean, comfortable, and a good size. Did not have breakfast in the hotel, but everyone should check out Casa Mingo just down the road for some excellent food and 'Cidre'.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cloughy1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location; in the middle of the city with the Metro across the road and in addition there was a nice Mall with cinema and plenty of eatery in it which was open until late - great if you wanted something quick to eat. The hotel its self is quite old and tired, with nothing particularly stimulating about it. The breakfast was average at best but just about served its purpose. The rooms were typically European in size and quality - small rooms small beds! Parking was €19 per day which I guess for the city is fairly good. If you are planning on spending 90% of your waking time out in the beautiful city of Madrid then you can't knock the hotel for its location. If on the other hand you are looking to chill out in the hotel for some of your time then I would recommend looking else where.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, everything else just OK”
Reviews.Author: kingskot
Reviews.Content: Good location, right across the street form the metro and the train station, and a short walk from the Royal Palace. The area is much better than I would expect for being near a train station in a major European city. The place was fine, although the walls were pretty thin. I didn't have a problem since my neighbors were pretty quite, but I could hear others flushing the toilet, etc. If somebody nearby watched one of the tiny TVs a lot it would have been a problem. The "wooden" floors were better than the dirty carpet I was expecting. Not a place for a romantic get away, but if you want a cheap base to see Madrid from it'll do the trick. Warning: no alarm clock, or any clock at all in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: JARPHX
Reviews.Content: The bar and housekeeping staff were excellent, and the hotel was well-located, given the sites we wanted to visit. However, our room faced Paseo de la Florida, and with the window open at night for some fresh air, the street lights and noise were disturbing. This is not something the hotel can control, but bring earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EastBoundTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little Hotel that is both very clean and very convenient to all things Madrid. The rooms are basic and a little dated as others have indicated but very comfortable. A lot of schools book their trip stay in this hotel so ask for a high floor to avoid the hallway commotion. The metro is right across the street which also has a nice shopping mall in it. Plenty of restaurants located right down the street. The Kings Palace is just a short walk from this location. The Hotel staff are very friendly and very accommodating. The only thing that bugged me a little, was that you had to pay 2 euro per day to use the Hotel safe in your room. Maybe it's a euro thing but I thought that should have been included in the room cost. On the plus side they have free wifi, which easily connects to a Smart Phone, iPad or Laptop. All in all, an excellent choice for an affordable Hotel in Madrid. Nice bakery just around the corner as well...

Reviews.Title: “Much nice than expected”
Reviews.Author: calamityjane1953
Reviews.Content: I had read some bad reviews of this hotel so it far exceeded my expectations.The booking in procedure was quick and the room was spacious and clean. Although the decor was outdated, the beds were comfortable and the shower worked. There was loads of wardrobe and drawer space. The location was perfect for the metro... just over the road and the river ran behind the hotel so plenty of opportunities for walking. I didnt eat there preferring to eat in any one of the many cafes close by. The hotel was very busy all the time with large parties arriving and leaving by coach but it never seemed overly noisy. I thought it was good value for money and would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with American-style amenities.”
Reviews.Author: kport8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group tour. The rooms were spacious with air conditioning, large bathrooms, and comfy beds. Everything was very clean too. They had a large continental breakfast with normal European choices and a hot item buffet ( bacon, sausage, eggs). They also has multiple elevators to get to your rooms (which isn't always the case.) The hotel seems to be very popular with group tours, but there were no issue with noise levels. It was very close to the city center and a three minute walk to the metro. Definitely one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Whole O
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel. I would stay there again. A shopping mall and a metro station are directly opposite the hotel on the other side of the road and the hotel is located one stop away from the centre (Principio Pio to Opera on line R). Rooms clean and staff friendly. The breakfasts are truly excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weweaver
Reviews.Content: This hotel had comfortable, clean rooms. It's nothing fancy but a great standard hotel. The breakfast buffet was really really good!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: jmetz47
Reviews.Content: While the lovely lobby is more plush than the rooms, this hotel is a great place to base your visit to Madrid. My room was fine and had everything I needed, but it is not as elaborate as some of the hotels we are used to in the US. The tiled bathroom was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable and I enjoyed my stay there. The eighth floor rooms have balconies that overlook the street. With the Metro station Principe Pio just across the street, you can easily make connections wherever you want to go. There is also a large shopping mall across the street that offers anything you would need.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: HBNJTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were part of a tour group and stayed 4 nights in this hotel. This hotel caters mostly to tour groups and has no interest in serving the individual customer. The walls of our room were paper thin and we could hear all the comings and goings in the hallway as well as the happenings in our neighbor's bathroom. I was afraid to put my bare feet on the carpeting - it was stained and does not appear to have ever been cleaned. The front desk staff were aloof and uppity and pretended not to see you. The continental breakfast was pathetic - canned fruit cocktail, hard-boiled eggs, and toast - those were some of the edible items. Yes this hotel is close to the Metro station, but do yourself a favor - walk a couple blocks and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: ““2 STAR” BACKPACKERS STANDARD. AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: col049_11
Reviews.Content: Suggest you check the review complaints as far back as 2004 nothing has changed obvious “Management” don’t care ! All 80 people from our tour group (average age 50 years? ) were most dissatisfied with this poor excuse for a 4 star hotel. It is only suitable for YOUNG BACKPACKERS looking for basic food & accommodation. Appalling Negatives: 400+ Rooms 1970 decor, old and tired, many complaints from our group, some smelt so bad (dry pipes) people had to change rooms. No fridge, Air/Con ineffective, no tea facilities. Bathroom inadequate, damaged tiles, water pressure varied, plastic curtain over bath. Breakfast and Dinner was the worse we had experienced during our 5 week European tour, so bad most people refused to eat it. Apparently the Restaurant and Cafeteria are contracted by the hotel. Meat tough, poor quality, limited vegetables, watery scrambled eggs and dessert, only canned fruit, terrible coffee, processed meat & cheese. Some food obviously recycled. Staff unfriendly, unhelpful unless you are Spanish, except for receptionist Gilabert ( must have read his bad reviews and improved). Old TV, poor reception no English channels. Sirens & traffic noise from busy railway station. Positives: Noisy but central location close to train. Free wireless. Clean rooms although inadequate unless your young and don‘t care, just want a cheap bed & terrible food. Summary: Terrible. All 80 people can’t be wrong. This is not a 4 star hotel lucky to be a 2 star. DEFINITELY NOT RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “TOTAL DISSATISFACTION”
Reviews.Author: Laurie H
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the glitzy foyer, for when you reach your room, you will be greeted by a place straight out of the 70s. The bathroom was totally antequated and produced odors which prermeated the bedroom. The TV, advertising 12 channels, could only produce 8, maybe because it was of the same vintage as the bathroom. The most disappointing aspect was the total disrespect of the staff, particularly in the restaurant, for clientel. The food was terrible and it was observed that the same rubbish was served to new arrivals a day later. How this hotel was ranked as 4 star remains a mystery. If you plan to visit Madrid steer clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: broccoli_lover
Reviews.Content: I stay 3 nights at the Florida Norte, the location was excellent, breakfast could be better, but was one of the few good breakfast I had in my trip to Europe. I stay in a triple room, the size was nice enough, and the bathroom was excellent. The staff was very helpful, we had a few problems with the room and the helped us right away. I think the hotel is quite modern, I work in a travel agency, and I visited a few hotels in Madrid, and the Florida Norte was modern compare to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very simple hotel, with low standard”
Reviews.Author: asdf1235
Reviews.Content: Especially the breakfast is very bad: Yellow liquid offered as "orange juice" , horrible coffee, bread made of cardboard. From the tap in the bathroom comes more air than water. Very thin walls, so you hear everything from neighboring rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star Hotel in a Perfect Location, GOOD BUT COULD BE GREAT”
Reviews.Author: uk2cairo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Madrid, stayed there for 5 nights. Hotel is in perfect location, directly opposite PRINCEPEE PIO metro station which takes you to the main square SOL, and many nearby attractions, Fashion shops, cafes, tapas, etc in under 7 minutes. There is also a nice shopping mall directly opposite the hotel, which is right by the metro station with many cafes and International fast food chains. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, but the room we stayed in was very basic, with an old TV set and only 5 or 6 spanish channels. The beds were like Ambulance stretchers, or the types of beds you see in hospitals, very hard, small and uncomfortable. The hotel is clean and somewhat modern with the typical understated Madridian elegance. We had a triple room with no amenities at all and it wasn't big enough for 3 people. Bathroom was a bit small but not unbearabley so. There are modern elevators in the hotel and surprising enough, it was always working unlike other spanish hotels. The hotel staff were little bit friendly but seemed more geared towards SPANISH SPEAKING business travellers. They will be pleased to help you with your directions but try not to bother them at peak times i.e. early morning and early evening as I saw a couple of them get a bit snappy with over-demanding English speaking tourists who didn't know how to fend for themselves. If you are visiting Madrid, the Cable Car is well worth a visit as well as El Retiro Park and Sol. Traveling by the Metro underground is very cheap at 1 euro per trip and its very easy to navigate. Madrid is a very expensive city, dinners at Mcdonalds, KFC, Burger King etc would cost just under 10 pounds for a regular meal. Cost of soft drinks cost around £1.20 and in tourist areas, the cost goes up by around 2 pounds (DAY LIGHT ROBBERY). If I were to travel to Madrid again in the future, i would deffinately go to Asda or Tescos, buy a multi pack and take that with me in my suitcase. Adios Amigos

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location - very good value”
Reviews.Author: Grant D
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its very central location just across the road from Principe Pio Metro station. The Madrid Metro station at one euro a journey is amazing value. From Principe Pio it is one stop to Opera - very convenient for the Royal Palace - and a further one stop takes you to the old streets of Puerta de la Sol. The hotel itself is in a relatively quiet location and after an efficient check-in we were given a nice quiet room at the back of the hotel which overlooks the river and a park. The room itself was clean and comfortable but a bit dated with refurbishments probably planned for the future. However, for 60 euros a night it represented exceptional value. While the public areas and facilities were probably four stars the room itself would be termed three stars but at the price not a problem. free internet access was a bonus. For the first time ever in a hotel they tried to charge me for ice which I requested from the bar. i told them to keep it. The restaurant in the hotel and breakfast is expensive (so we did not eat in the hotel) but there are many cheap dining options in the street outside the hotel. Parking is available in the secure garage facility underneath the hotel. at 18 euros a day probably OK for a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Nevermore”
Reviews.Author: Ashenriqs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far away to be a four stars. The worst service I ever had. The concierge treats you like he is doing a favor for you instead of his job. Awful rooms and awful service

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: DublinSimoncowell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in May with my other half. The hotel is lovely. The Foyer is very grand, however the rooms don't reflect the luxury in the foyer. The rooms are fine, clean & spacious. Our room overlooked the Casa de Campo park, lovely view of the river & the trees. Plenty of space in the room, even has a modern TV. The bathroom is a little dated as mentioned in previous reviews, however it is clean & does the job! The staff at reception weren't overly friendly/ enthusiastic. The hotel also has free Wi-Fi which is a bonus. The location is excellent. Straight across from the Principe Pio Metro station which is also a shopping centre which was a surprise to us. The Metro system is great. €1 for a unlimited journey with as many change overs as you want with Metros coming every 2 mins. The Principe Pio has a large selection of stores Zara, H&M, Jack & Jones, Kiko & many shoe shops & cosmetics/perfume shops. It also has a convenience store called OpenCor which has confectionery, booze & any last min essentials you may have forgotten. Hotel all is all is a great base for visiting all the major sights & even Parque Warner. Great value for money, would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: KT-BRT
Reviews.Content: Like other reviews have stated, the rooms are dated and small - but how much time do you spend in the room anyway? The bathroom has pink fixtures and older tile, the water pressure left a lot to be desired in the shower - but for us, the location made up for the room shortcomings. Located right across the street from the metro station and the shopping mall, it's easy to get around. We walked to the palace and back, and even from the Opera house and Plaza Mayor it was not an unpleasant walk. There is a brand new, recently completed park just behind the hotel which will be gorgeous once it has grown up. The service was fine - we ordered pitchers of sangria in the bar one night, poured two glasses and realized that the glasses were filthy (lipstick stains, food stuck to them). The server seemed put out when we complained, and then charged us for the full pitchers even though we had to throw out what was poured into the dirty glasses. The breakfast buffet was fine, but no fresh fruit - only canned, which was disappointing. Again, the great location makes up for some of the dated decor, and service shortfalls - eating across the street or downtown is a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe a three star”
Reviews.Author: OkieOmnivore
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a group trip and the last two nights, we stayed at Florida Norte. The location is great but the rooms are cramped and stuffy. If you are a woman, you won't like the bathroom. There is zero counter space for cosmetics and personal items and the lighting is not good. The lobby is nice and the hotel staff is helpful but the breakfast buffet we had was pretty bad. It was the only place we went in Spain that had bad coffee. I'll go back to Madrid but will definitely stay somewhere else. Madrid is too easy to get around in to put up with a hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “excellant location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: lindavey
Reviews.Content: booked in for a long weekend and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the rooms even central heating which was a bonus. convenient for the metro, shopping an restaurants. wouldn't hesitate to use again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: madjide
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 days at the end oct 2010. We chose this hotel as it was close to the areas of madrid we wanted to see.The hotels was clean and comfortable and served its purpose without costing a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Fine enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wamjimjam
Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel from the airport was so inexpensive and straight forward and complteted in around 40 minutes ,the metro is across the busy road from the hotel ,check was quick and very professional ,i was armed with my basic Espanol but the staff were fluent in English,rooms were ok nothing fancy but comfortable ,spacious and clean ,alas no tea or coffee making facilities in the room,bathroom was quite large ,the shower was slightly awkward as you hold the shower head to wash yourself and it tended to shoot the hot water towards the wall,the bar was fine if very limited in selection of beers ,only one choice rather bland Dutch beer,i didnt dine in the hotel but the food looked plentiful and smelt rather tasty,overall id give the hotel a thumbs up ,not a 4 star but im not complaining with the fantastic rate i paid to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was good, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: mad_jenny1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in november 2010. The weather at this time was dry all week but cold at nights. (still not as cold as scotland so was a nice surprise) Good location from the airport, on the metro take line 8 and get off at Nuevos Ministerios and then take line 10 and get off at Principe Pio. You can see the hotel from this stop and is across the road. (the metro is only 1 euro to get there but you can buy a "10 journey ticket" which is 9 euros and can be used by more than one person, as you can pass it back to your partner too). On arrival, hotel reception was huge and only took few minutes to checked in. The staff were pleasant enough however answered in spanish mainly. We were taken to our room which was just the normal standard room. Was clean , tidy and spacious. Room had bath and shower. After being in the room about 2 hours the noise from the room above was horendous. We complained to staff and they spoke with the people involved who turned out to be children on a school trip. This did not work and the noise continued, this was around midnight. We complained again and were told by a certain member of staff who was very unpleasant and unhelpful that there was nothing they could do unless we wanted to go speak to the teachers and children ourselves or move hotels as all the rooms were full. With persistance and speaking to another member of staff, they then decided to give us an upgrade and we ended up on the top floor, room with a balcony, which was perfect. The bed was comfortable however was 2 beds pushed together instead of a double. The room was made up every day even though some days we had long lies. We did not have the breakfast from the hotel as supermarket across the road was better value for money. The hotel also had a lounge, internet access (not free), hairdressers and a small shop for souveneirs which was nice. Across the road from the hotel is a large shopping centre Principe Pio which has all the usual eating places mcdonalds, kfc and burger king. There is also a 24 hr supermarket and a cinema within. The hotel is within walking distance to Gran Via (about 10min walk uphills) which is the main drag in Madrid however you can also get the metro. During our time there, we visited the Bernabeu stadium (can get there by metro or by tour bus - costs 16 euros for 1 adult - unguided tour), athletico madrid stadium - calderon, (had to reach by foot which was a very long walk), hard rock cafe (walk or metro), madrid vision bus tour which has 2 lines (can buy tickets from hotel or at any small kiosks -costs 17 euros for 1 adult for 1 day, or 21 euros for 1 adult for 2 days). There were places that we didnt visit due to time and some places were closed this time of year but looked excellent. Muy Cerca De ti - which is a zoo/aquarium. Parque de attracciones -theme park which is only open at weekends at this time of year. Parque Warner - warner brothers theme park. Loads of museums, food places, churches, real palace (across from hotel) and bull fighting (only from march - october). The only downside to this holiday was that most people only spoke to us in spanish but it wasnt really a problem as there was always a way to communicate. Overall i thought it was a great location which had great access to all of the above mentioned places and I would recommend to everyone. Plenty to do for adults and children and was not expensive at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, breakfast a bit suspect!”
Reviews.Author: KingpinCambridge
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a large stag party and our stay was back in mid July. Classed as a 4 star hotel but probably closer to a 3 star. On our arrival we found the check in was very quick and efficient considering that we had a group of 18 and of course it didn't take us long to make our way to the hotel bar. Drinks were reasonably priced considering Madrid is generally an expensive place - around 2 euros for a small glass of beer. There are several tapas bars within 200 metres of the hotel which we found very friendly and once again quite reasonable in price. We were all placed in rooms on the same floor which helped with keeping the group together and i found the rooms to be very comfortable and well air conditioned. The only downside was that the bathroom was a bit dated, but it was functional. The location of this hotel is good - only takes about 10 mins on foot to get to the royal palace from here. The 'Sol' area where many bars and restaurants are is within 20mins and directly across the road from the hotel is the 'Principe Pio' metro station which houses a shopping centre and has direct links by underground to many of the places of interest in Madrid. The line goes straight through to the 'Santiago bernabeau' which is a good value for money trip. It cost us 15 euros each to do the stadium tour and gives you access to the museum, trophy room, dug outs and even the changing rooms. An open top bus is also a good idea - we picked one up from outside the royal palace and it cost 17 euros for unlimited use on that day - You get a guide book and earphones for the audio system and it will take you past many of Madrids places of interest. We all had a great time and would recommend Madrid to anyone - The only downside was the breakfast at our hotel which was poor. Due to the nature of our trip not many of our group made it for breakfast on the first day as we had been up over 24 hours, but on the 2nd morning we realised hat we hadn't missed much. There didn't seem to be a great deal of choice other than scrambled eggs which were watery and some franfurters that were equally as watery. All in all it was a great trip and generally i would say that this hotel is good value for money and I think you would pay quite a bit more for a similar quality hotel on the 'Gran Via'

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but STINKY”
Reviews.Author: cruss12
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location right across the street from a metro stop and walking distance to Campo Del Moro, Palacio Real and the Cathedral. However I would only recommend staying here if you like the smell of sewage and cigarette smoke. There was also not air in the room so we had to leave the window open at night which meant a constant barrage of noise from the traffic below. Also the front desk staff is not the friendliness and doesn’t speak English well.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghNel
Reviews.Content: Four star going on two! Needed some work done on the entrance "canopy". Reception area looked good but lounge area needed upgrading as armchairs have seen better days. Room very basic but clean. Bathroom needed refurbished. The pink suite told all. On plus side very near transport links, train, metro, buses and taxi rank and fairly central. Having said all that, we were on a tour so don't know what the tour company paid for the three nights. In the end of the day, you only get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy and poor breakfast and run down rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Scottourist
Reviews.Content: Good location next to metro and bus service to major sites.Rooms are shabby and fitments broken.Noise from other guests is a major problem through the ducting system. Breakfasts are poor, coffee was not drinkable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad beds”
Reviews.Author: melonga
Reviews.Content: The best of this hotel is the location. It is at a walking distance from the Royal Palace, Almudena Cathedral, San Antonio de la Florida Chapel, La Gran Via, Sabatini Gardens and The Gardens of Campo del Moro. The personnel is friendly and willing to help you. The hotel needs a renovation badly. Once you enter the hotel it smells bad. The furniture in the reception area are old. The worst are the beds. They are basically cots with a thin mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Would never return”
Reviews.Author: Miguel10203040
Reviews.Content: Except for the location (very central) nothing in this hotel deserves 4 stars, not even 3. The rooms are very poorly decorated. The A.C was not working(at 37 degrees celius!!) and after spending a lot of time dealing with the reception we were transferred to another room. The hotel is huge,so is the dining room. Breakfast equals 2 star hotel. No service at all. We asked to call for a cab to the airport, the answer was that there is a taxi station not far away. It was true - but of course no taxis, and we had to carry our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Mark_39018
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located opposite the Principe Pio metro station with a supermarket in it. Good if you need to pick up a few necessities. Room was decent clean but no Minibar. Lots of restaurants along the street. Hotel seemed to be very crowded with lots of people milling around the lobby. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. I would say its ok for a night's stay. TV channels were all in Spanish and there are no bell boys.

Reviews.Title: “A 4-star hotel without minibar :):)”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas1964
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights there. Yes, it is clean. Yes, it's location is good: we booked a room with a balcony, and the view was nice and calm - a river, a large park, etc. BUT. You have to carry your luggage youself. There is NO MINIBAR in the room (four stars?), nor even a frige, no tea accessories, no bathgown, no slippers, When late at night I asked a receptionist where I could buy me drinking water he told me that I had to go to the downtown or call roomservice. Later my Spanish friend told me that there was a 24-hour food shop just across the street! We had only one breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, but the food was of a very low quality: a very cheap juice, sour coffee, etc... Our personal recommendation is: overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location! Poor property.”
Reviews.Author: andrewtscheer
Reviews.Content: I was in Madrid with a high school EF Tour. We spent two nights in this hotel and I was less than impressed. There are many groups that stay here so be prepared to be bothered by huge groups sitting in the lobby, halls, common areas, and such. We were playing chess in the lobby and a smoking hobo runs in screaming in Spanish and stole a wallet that was on the table. Being in Madrid we were well aware of the pickpockets and such but we thought that we were safe inside the lobby of the hotel. When wee told the management they were mostly indifferent and only said that they would call the police but it wouldn't do much good. The doors to the rooms in this hotel do not close and lock automatically. This is a serious security issue. There was a drunk French guy that wandered in someone's room and tried to get in the bed with someone on our tour. They were both very freaked out and the man proceeded to run out of the room and urinate in the hall. This was an extremely scary event that could be easily avoided. The Decor of the hotel and overall style is very 1979. It is very shabby. The Location is amazing. It is one of the only upsides to the the hotel. The Principe Pio Mall is right across the street and is a huge metro station and is very well connected to the rest of Madrid. If you have a choice you can do a lot better. If you have any questions Please Please contact me!!!

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: BRIGHTON001
Reviews.Content: Well located, next to train and metro stations, close to Royal Palace. The first room on arrival which we were offered was small, dark and old bed and old TV. After we requested a better room we were given nice, clean, modern, quet room with LCD TV. TV has only spanish channels.. This is a nice hotel if you are planning to a lot of you time outdoors. Bakery and supermarket are next door.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but...”
Reviews.Author: jurizzo
Reviews.Content: ...but the many teenagers groups were so noisy! The rooms was big and clean, the breakfast fine and had free wi-fi in the lobby. The location is good, just in front of a metro, near the Palace... Has a good room service, too. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: BoBuller22
Reviews.Content: The workers were very kind and patient with our group. the hotel was great and was close to the rail and what we wanted to see

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: edinburghjock
Reviews.Content: both my partner and i thought the service of this hotel was good with helpfull reception,the rooms a little small but ideal size for a short break clean and bright with a decient size bathroom,we were bed and breakfast which we both agreed was good value, breakfast was decient enough,you can fill up enough to last you through out the day,great location metro station directly over the street from hotel only 2 euro on metro to airport this will only take about 25 mins better than 37 euro for a cab that takes about the same time as we discovered after landing late at night,GREAT local resturants/bars on the same street as hotel with good prices,meal for two with a bottle of wine each around 50 euros,also tapas with every drink,comare this to the heart of the city were two large beers and a small nibble cost 21 euros,also a short walk away is the cable cars that give you a great view of madrid this is a must,liked best location and hotel in general also proper spanish culture,liked least leaving madrid

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, great location”
Reviews.Author: alza1
Reviews.Content: Decent rooms and furniture, VERY pink (even the toilets and walls!) and slightly dirty bathrooms. Amazing location right across the street from the metro and a mall, in addition there is a grocery two doors down that sells useful items like snacks and phone cards. Breakfast okay, with good cheese and bread, but the juice was terrible as well as the odd machine it came from. Also, the eggs were gross and cold. If you can't use stairs, make sure your room is served by the elevator, ours was not and you had to walk down two flights of stairs to get to it. Odd layout. The whole hotel had a very impersonal feel to it, and the staff was very aloof. I would skip it unless you want the location and can't find it elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good as I hoped”
Reviews.Author: belanda1
Reviews.Content: Was not as good as we hoped, or better yet how we found it on the internet. I have an objection to the room which was not very clean and breakfast as the breakfast room which looked quite poor. But I would recommend it because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nothing else”
Reviews.Author: twnygal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT a four star. It is a large hotel with impersonal services. There is no decoration and does not have any characteristics. The hotel staff is courteous but not warm and friendly at all. The check in/out was like a data processing center. All services, such as internet, safety box, etc require additional fees. The location is great. It's right across from the metro station and within walking distance to Plaza de Espana and the Royal Palace. I'd recommend this hotel only if you get a great deal. If you expect services, then go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly... not 4 stars though”
Reviews.Author: YorkTom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - just opposite Príncipe Pío metro station and close to the Royal Palace. Príncipe Pío also is a huge shopping mall which was busy late into the night when we visited, and has clothes shops, a food hall, supermarket and much more. The hotel was welcoming, the staff knew what they were doing and you can tell at one point is was a very modern, almost luxurious place to stay. That said, time has taken its toll and it is a little dated now. The rooms were clean, well stocked and the place seem well looked after though. We paid €65 a night for a double room which was reasonable. There was an all-night room service who were great and check-in and check-out were seamless. They even let us check in earlier than we should have. Oh and Cafe Horn nearby is great for breakfast. Summary -great location and not bad for the price. I would happily stay there again, but if you're looking for something modern, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to Plaza D'espana- easy access - nothing else”
Reviews.Author: jcb193
Reviews.Content: Pros -This hotel is very easy to get to, close to the Plaza d'Espana, right across ths street from the metro stop. About 10 min walk to Plaza d'espana. Easy to get to from airport. Cons -Room is the equivalent of my college dorm. Bathroom is redone, but the beds and decore are about 30 years old. Hotel has nice facilities, nothing special. Excellent location for walking to Plaza d'Espana, very easy to get to from Metro (save yourself the taxi ride). Other than that, nothing remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “large hotel across the street from metro”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_traveladdict
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the city center, but it is across the street from a metro station (Principe Pio). It is a far walk to museums (Prado, Reina Sofia), but less than a 1/2 hour walk to Puerto del Sol and 15 minutes to the Gran Via. There are many restaurants within a block or two of the hotel, and there is a mall in the metro station. The big plus for this hotel is that it is quiet. I live in a big city near downtown, but I only have a certain tolerance for noise. Staying near the Puerto del Sol is like staying in a hotel in Times Square. This hotel offers a good alternative at what seems like a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel at quite a good location”
Reviews.Author: Bella_S_9
Reviews.Content: We were a bit afraid because of some review we've read - but we enjoyed our stay. The rooms are comforable and clean, the service was ok. The hotel is exactly in front of the Rain station - there is no noise but there is a commercial center there with shops and some food options which is very comfortable. There a couple of pubs near the hotel as well, and we ate there breakfast (the breakfast at the hotel is quite expensive). The hotel is 10-15 minutes walk from Place d'Espania, and it's not a problem to get there by feet We did not have a car in Madrid so the parking did not matter to us

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, below average amenities”
Reviews.Author: Avishay
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very convenient for touring madrid. Close to Placio Real. Metro station across the street. Room has no minibar. It was impossible to adjust the airconditioner temperature. The use of the safe will cost additional 2 euro/day. Internet use is 7 euro/hr. Breakfast is very poor. The coffee is tasteless, the "orange juice" is a strange yellow drink. The hotel staff is polite and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay in this old hotel”
Reviews.Author: deirdre565
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the worst hotels i have ever stayd at. Our negative experiences started immediatly at the check in. The people from check in where very rude, they did not make us feel welcome, they did not speak any english en finally i was asked to sign something, i usually dont sign anything before i know WHAT i am signing, the man at check in started to raise his voice with irritation because i did not sign within 2 seconds, when i asked him what is was, that i was signing, he just yelled at me that i had to sign.. that was all the english he knew.. SIGN!!!! Ok bad start.. we wanted to take the elivator, once we steped into one, the buttons where stuck and we had to switch to a different elivator.. I like my elivators to work without having my worried about getting stuck in between floors. When we got to our room, it smelled horrible, like the room was full of dust and no window had been open for weeks. The next day when we got back from shopping, we found out that our room was not cleaned. We mentioned to us that for next time, we should leave our room earlier so that roomservice can clean our room. I was stunned we go away for a getaway and want to sleep in, maybe stay in bed untill 11 and then go shopping. Roomservice apparently only cleans your room unless you are out of your room at 9am! The only positive thing about the hotel is the convenient location accros from a subway station. Other than that..nothing really. Will not stay here again. They advertise this as a 3 or 4 star hotel. I would not give it even 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Columbo Film!!”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterEurotourer
Reviews.Content: Excuse the title but this hotel was so dated it was like a 70s Columbo film, you expected Peter Falk to walk around the corner at any moment! 70s decor needs badly updating, horrible green colour all round the hotel, the sofas, carpet floor tiles & everything. The room wasn't much better, definitely not 4 star although the breakfast was quite good for a Spanish Hotel. Also, after reading previous reviews I expected it to be a short walk to Madrid Centre - it was at least 40 mins and that was up a very steep hill. Also beware if you are driving, parking is 20 euro a day in the shopping centre opposite and you have to walk through the shopping centre to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A motel”
Reviews.Author: justrateit
Reviews.Content: Even though it is 4 star as it claims, this is a very low end hotel, the room looks more humble than the Motels that we stayed before. We first got a room that is so smelly with huge mosquito, we had to change the room once. Even worse is all their service guys do not smile at all. They don't even look at the customer when talking. Their check-in process is extrememly slow, still using paper to keep track. Overall, the stay was very uncomfortable. We were definitely not expecting a 4 star like Florida Notre.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Average”
Reviews.Author: mplsfamily
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be nothing special. It was clean and met our needs but there was no charm or character or anything to make it interesting. Our first night was too hot since we couldn't get the air conditioner to work and when we moved it was to an updated room. They are in the beginning process of updated all of the rooms. It was very convenient to the Metro but a bit set apart from the action of Madrid. It is across the street from a large mall with a movie theater and many restaurants. We stayed 3 nights here and 3 nights in Hostal Acapulco located in the busy area of Puerta Del Sol and much prefered the latter. We rarely used the Metro when staying in Puerta Del Sol. As others have stated, breakfast was not good. On the plus side, there is a bakery right next door! If you do stay here, absolutely go to Casa Mingo for chicken. Turn left out the front door and it is several blocks down on the other side of the street. Yum.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Florida Norte”
Reviews.Author: BraveheartA
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews AFTER booking this hotel so was pleasantly surprised.Location was fantastic as used Metro and buses at door.Staff friendly. Room spacious and bathroom spotless. Breakfast had a good variety but fresh fruit and yoghurt would have been nice. Only gripe was the orange juice which came out of a machine and tasted ghastly!On the whole a very good hotel which I'd recommend and would return to .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Nick_SueCambridge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location for the Metro connections to the city center and has excellent views of the palace from the bedroom window. The staff where friendly and helpfull. The rooms where very clean, but I am not to sure the hotel is worth the 163 euro charge stated in the hotel brochure, but having only paid £45 a night on the internet I found it to be excellent value. Overall the hotel is a very good budget hotel in a brilliant location of the city, which would be an impossible challange to find in London, espcially with such an amazing view at the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giselle47
Reviews.Content: 12 of us went to this Hotel for a weekend break. Great location for shopping, and transport (Metro) system. The rooms are big but the walls are paper thin. Could hear conversations, and other less pleasant noises, from the room next door! Breakfast was included - not really worth much Grunted at by the concierge. Bacon was not bad, sausages were terrible. Coffee was water and the "fresh" juices were watered down diluted orange/pineapple. It was so hot in dining room, you had to drink and the juices tasted different each refill. All in all the visit was not too bad. And a tourist bus trip round Madrid is well worth it. Watch out for pickpockets! 2 of our party fell foul to them, which put a complete downer on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wutan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Florida Norte for 3 days in mid-Aug. and found the location to be excellent. About a 15 min. walk to the Palace and Gran Via. There's also an Opencor market across the street where we bought wholesome food and snacks daily. Lots of shopping in that mall as well as a Starbucks and a movie theatre. Down the street are many restaurants including Casa Mingo, the famous chicken place. The hotel rooms were quite nice and clean and the A/C worked well. Didn't try the food at the hotel restaurants as we ate out at the many places down the street. Staff was OK and helpful. It's quieter than the hotels on Gran Via or Plaza Mayor areas which means you can get a good night's sleep. It's not a 4 star hotel and the lobby was outdated but for the price and location, you can't go wrong. Believe me, things in Spain can get expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chinaski7628
Reviews.Content: Great location and comfortable. I found the front desk helpful. One member of my group had problems with his room and he was immediately transfered to another room no problem. Close to the Metro, but an uphill walk to the Palace, Palza Espana and Plaza Mayor- though not a bad one if you have the energy. The rooms and the hotel itself are a little outdated and gaudy, but to be honest, the city itself is so alive I was only in my room to sleep :)

Reviews.Title: “Where Not to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: shamz30
Reviews.Content: If you want to know where not to stay in Madrid.. it would be the Florida Norte. It was by far the worst hotel I stayed in out of 4 others around Spain. The rooms were so out dated it made me feel quite uncomfortable i.e. the bedspreads were a dirty green, the view was of neighbouring apartments and their laundry lines, the telephone so old that dialing out was incredibly frustrating, the bathroom was a dirty brown with a variety of plant life under the sink. If one is looking for a botanical experience in their hotel.. the Florida Norte would be it. The receptionist Antonio Gilabert was rude, uncaring and intolerant and last but not least the breakfast was something to be experienced in the manner of runny and watery eggs, old stale meats, hard bread and cola cao( hot chocolate) had to be requested. However, when i did ask for them .. the guy was very nice and polite. Yes, It is almost ok location wise... as restaurants and a lovely mall is right opposite the hotel. It is 25 mins to the Royal Palace and Gran via is not too far. There are telephone booths in the lobby of the hotel for those who cannot use the telephones in their rooms and the shopping is not too bad.. also it is a quick ride to the airport. I shall not be staying here again. It does not deserve a four star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Excuse for lodging”
Reviews.Author: hrhsan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not even worth the 3 star rating is given . The Good Good location, just opposite major shopping mall, restautants and Palace, gran via. 25 minutes to airport. porter service. reasonable hotel shop for souvenirs ets. telephone booths in hotel. (you will know why later!) decent room size. Clean bed sheets. decent size bathrooms. THE BAD Decor leaves much to be desired , 70's style hunter green and brown, garrish. Rude British accented receptionist man! There was no AC operating till 7 pm at night (we were told it was conserving energy). Room phones did not work very old phones. I was in a second floor room, my view was that of a apartment complex''s behind so i saw into other peoples homes and laundry lines and backyards. Toilet was unclean leftover hairs from previous tourist. The room reeked of high turnover tourists. Dirty bed spread. OH!! teh best part was when i looked under the sink there was foliage growing (yes! real weeds or roots - i cannot say for sure i am not a botanist) but i am sure it was a growth. Breakfast is not good watered down milk, soupy eggs, old cured meats, hot chocolate only when requested. bad tempered staff. do try and get another hotel, i understand this place is cheap but there must be a better option, it was the worst place i stayed in my whole trip which consisted of 4 hotels around spain.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: khmerbleu
Reviews.Content: good location,train station and metro directly opposite the hotel a 10 min stroll to the royal palace. rooms average size and a bit dated but have their own safe { 2 euros a day } reception staff helpful and pleasant although a 4* rating is pushing it .overall it represented value for money on the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Grex
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with 14 other girls for my hen weekend. Wasn't expecting anything great after reading the reviews on this site but I was pleasantly surprised. We got a very good deal on the rooms and the hotel was ideal for what we wanted. The rooms were ok but we didn't spend a lot of time in them to care too much. The location is great, it's right opposite a metro station and shopping centre with a good choice of places to eat and a supermarket. It's a 10 minute walk to the Palace and about 20 minute walk to the Plaza Mayor (all up hill). The hotel is a little bit out of the way of the major attractions but still walkable through some nice gardens. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. We had room only so can not comment on the food but the wine is cheap in the hotel bar. Please be aware of the pickpockets in Madrid, two of our group had our purses stolen and were constantly being watched by small groups of people when shopping and especially on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Pole
Reviews.Content: If the location is all you want this the rigth place for you. Very good location, close to the metro and bus station, close to the Royal Palace. Price wise this hotel is also a good choice but....all the rest about the hotel can be said in five words : "Not a four star Hotel"!!! No minibar in the room , very old furniture, a lot of noise coming from other rooms and from the road works. Personnel quite unfriendly. Breakfast just terrible brrrr..... We were a group booked there two months in advance but when we arrived they could not find our reservations and we had to wait and were given rooms all in different floors. If I will ever be in Madrid again I know where Not to stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK - But not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: We booked six non-smoking rooms at this hotel. On arrival we were given smoking rooms. When we pointed out the error, the non-too cheerful man behind reception told us that you get what you ask for so we should have specified non-smoking rooms. On checking the papers relating to our booking he could see clearly that we had asked for non-smoking rooms. No apology was offered. Instead we were told the hotel was full so we should ask again the following day if we wanted our rooms changed. In the event, this was not necessary as the rooms did not smell of smoke but it was not exactly a welcoming experience. The hotel is located a fair bit outside the centre of Madrid (on the wrong side of the Royal Palace) so it's a good walk to get to where you want to go. There is, however, a very efficient metro shuttle service between the station directly opposite the hotel and the Opera Metro station which is a good starting point in the old centre of Madrid. There is currently a lot of construction work taking place at the front and back of the hotel but these works did not extend into the evening or night and were not a problem. The hotel rooms were pleasant enough and reasonably sized, though a bit dated, but the bathroom fittings had certainly seen better days. We had, amongst us, at least two cracked and one leaking sink and, in my room, the pink toilet cistern had been broken more than once and had been cemented together again where it sat slumped forlornly against the wall. Each operation of the flush caused the lid to leap up alarmingly. Breakfast was OK but the orange juice tasted strange. The coffee, dispensed from a machine, was literally undrinkable so we all reverted to tea. The range of food available for breakfast was not what you would expect from a four star, for example, there was no fresh fruit and even the fruit salad was tinned. The bar area was located in the cafeteria and was fine. However, it closed at 11:45 promptly each night and was no longer available to anybody including residents. To be fair, it did say that these were the opening times but it did come as a bit of a shock, nonetheless, that the bar in a four star hotel closed so early.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: icekween
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute and we got what seemed to be a great deal. We were really disappointed once we got there - whilst the rooms were spacious the decor left a lot to be desired - unless you still live in the 70's! But at least it was clean! We had the breakfast buffet which was very average and whatever you do make sure you finish well before the 10.30am closing time because on the first day they took everything away whilst most people were still eating so if you think you can slope in a 10.25 am (like a poor unfortanate couple did) then think again! Very poor service in my opion - especially as this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel. Its one redeeming quality though was the location - opposite a main station/metro and a revamped shopping centre and cinema and a decent walk into Gran Via. So all in all - certainly does not merit its star rating but if you manage to get a cheap room and are not put off by the huge groups of students that seemed be checking in every day, mean staff, outdated decor and just want a good base to travel around town then maybe this is for you! Whatever you do, do not pay the outrageous 157Euros (for a double) rate that they reckon they can charge!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Skelsy
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel as part of our course in college, none of us had ever been to Madrid so we didn't know what to expect when we got there. Before we went away I read some of the reviews about this hotel and was not looking forward to it. To get to the hotel was really easy just two short metro train rides away straight from the airport and when you get off the train the hotel is literally across the road which i thought was great as you can get anywhere in Madrid using the metro link. Also across the road from the hotel is a shopping mall Principe Pio which was very large and had many shops and great places to eat. I think the problem with this hotel is the rating it has....its not a four star maybe 20 years ago. BUT the hotel and rooms were clean spacious and light and i didn't see any fault in them, I thought it was good value for money. We didnt use the hotel restaurant as there was so much choice in the mall across the road to eat or you just had a short journey away to get to a high street to eat. Overall I had a fantastic trip and would definately go back to Madrid and most likely that hotel because of how convienient it is to get around!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go There!!”
Reviews.Author: travellingmaster
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely appalling hotel - the rooms are dated and it smelled! The breakfast is almost inedible: bacon, scrambled eggs looked like food you could feed your dog!, watered down fruit(?) juice! There are serious buildings works outside the hotel! The hotel staff seem friendly but I'm sure as hell not going there again! This hotel is rated a 4* but the hotel is so bad the 4* seems like a joke - someone's having a laugh for sure! "DREADFUL"

Reviews.Title: “Good all round experiencfe”
Reviews.Author: melly7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a brilliant location, right opposite the Principe Pio station which is one stop away from Opera & the Plaza Mayor, and therefore also easy to get to from the airport. Yes the hotel's decor is a little dated, but it is clean and tidy. I can't say much about any of the staff there though, I'm not sure if it was just the language barrier, but they always seemed a bit surly and annoyed to have to help, which is their job! Overall I'd stay again if I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Grouptourlider
Reviews.Content: I was three time in this hotel with diffferent groups of tourist. It's true that the hotel is needing a remodelation, but I agree that the location is the best, the staff is always very helpful and friendly, really professionals, the lobby very nice and big . The room was very clean. Buffet Breakfast is served in restaurant in the cellar, but it's clean and light, it contains eggs, bacon, croissants, several tips of bread, cereals, coffee, tea, milk, juices, etc. Metro is across the street. It's a cheap option of accommodation in Madrid with a great service

Reviews.Title: “terrible.”
Reviews.Author: telis
Reviews.Content: we stayed there fortunatelly only for a night on our way to canary islands. it is a dark place!the rooms are from the 70's,there was not enough lighting in the corridors,breakfast was the worst i have ever eaten in a crowded undergound restaurant. even the locals don't have good opinion about this hotel and certainly they are right! the only good think about this property is the very good location and that's all!keep away!
